subtasks: Research and planning for seaweed cultivation
Selecting suitable locations for oyster lines
Planting small seaweed plants into nets
Attaching nets with seaweed plants to existing oyster infrastructure
Monitoring seaweed growth and managing the "floating forest"
Harvesting mature seaweed after two years
Assessing seaweed yield and market value for sushi rolls
Exploring applications of seaweed in livestock feed and sustainable packaging
Evaluating environmental benefits of seaweed farming (nitrogen removal)
Identifying risks associated with oyster cultivation (e.g., disease)
Diversifying oyster farm products to mitigate climate change risks
Considering the global seaweed market and forecasted growth
Projecting the economic impact of seaweed farming in Australia
